OW2 isnt bad, its just disappointing.

I think ow2 is alot better than the state OW was in at the end of its life, but it has so many problems of its own.

if you're still looking to scratch that OW itch in 2023 theres still fun to be had here, but its just so far off the peak days of OW that 2 does feel like a disappointment in the end, not to mention the PVE. 

with the negativity in the review you'd probably expect this to be a negatively tagged review but i would still recommend the game as it can still be fun, i just think its far off what it was.

After having played this game for over 3000 hours I can finally say that it has only been downhill since 2018.

Do not get into this game, but if you do, NEVER. EVER. give them your money.

I have played games since the 80's and can conclusively tell you that overwatch 2 is the best multiplayer game ever made. Endless strategies and multiple skill ceilings. There is no getting bored in this game as if you are fed up playing mr legs(soldier) running around shooting at things, next game you can play a giant monkey with a lightening cannon or any of the other completely different characters. Yes the devs promised too much and there was a period where there was no new heros or content released but look; NOTHING out there even comes close to this game, it is the chess of multiplayer gaming and if you are complaining about lacking of new content and how we are being treated by the devs you may be undeserving of just how good this game is.
Downloaded this game just to leave a negative review. Wish we had OW1 back.

Overwatch 2, is a game that's so close to being fun but has so much shit that bogs it down from something I'll actually come back to. if you wanna play this game, I recommend you instead play other multiplayer games that are more worth your time.

Just play deep rock galactic instead, it's a quality multiplayer game with devs that actually care about the game you paid for. its a four player coop game where you play as dwarves with different classes and most of all, progression is actually fun to get through and the mission structure is great. it's real cheap on sales too and light on hard drive space.

Bonjour,
souffrant de stress post-traumatique suite aux incidents liÃ©s Ã  Diablo IV et OW 2, je ressens l'arrivÃ©e de Blizzard sur Steam avec une angoisse aussi intense que celle d'une victime qui verrait son ancien agresseur revenir et entrer chez elle.

The Good: OW2 Porn

The Bad: Everything else

And The Ugly: Blizzard Entertainment

TLDR: Decent enough game, predatory micro-transactions, taking steps in the right direction to fix their mistakes, never should have had the mistakes, but God's sake, stop being sheeple and jumping on a band wagon with negative reviews. Everyone who is reviewing plays this game daily, 100%. Get off your horses, yell at the real faults, and stop the crusade.

For goodness sake, the reviews are ridiculous. It was called that this would get review bombed, and it did. Don't let a bunch of other people dictate whether or not it's good - it's just what Overwatch was, but with predatory micro-transactions. Which are, you know, completely optional. The only one that is certainly needed to enjoy the content is the battle pass, and unfortunately the bundle with the available PVE options. This is a downside. PVE should not be charged for, it should have been its own game as was touted, but due to the lacklustre reveal we'd be getting not what we paid for, it should not have been 'sold'.. But, while I understand that the game has its flaws, and downsides, overall it plays like any other in the genre. Taking in to account that the team is trying, and listening to its players, goes a long way. Do they do things right? Not always. Does any game?

Pros: Good character design, fluid levels, responsive team of devs who is attempting to fix issues and is open and listens (Yes, even if it is NOW that they're listening, and not then), excellent audio, interactive custom modes, pretty, pretty, pretty game, excellent cinematics, fantastic voice acting, extensive Rule 34 for those who like that kinda thing.

Cons: Predatory micro-transactions, incredibly high pricing, gated PVE, pandering to certain communities at some points, which is obvious and embarrassing for all involved, toxic community in all brackets of ranked competitive play that doesn't seem to get culled very well, bug fixes take forever (I'm looking at you, Kiriko.)

There's more to the con list, but that's all I could think of off the top of my head. Overall, it's a standard F2P FPS game. Chill.
